caption_original:
You always wanted to visit the Canadian Rockies but just haven't got to it yet?

These breathtaking photos from @TravelChannel will surely get you motivated! http://ow.ly/YIfBP Jasper National Park, Banff National Park, Kootenay National Park, Waterton Lakes National Park and Yoho National Park.

caption_original:
On this day in 1947, the village of Snag in the Yukon hit -62.8 degrees Celsius, the lowest confirmed temperature ever recorded in North America!

Visit our “This Week in History” section to learn more: ow.ly/XH3Px 
This photo was taken in Kluane National Park and Reserve, south of Snag. Parks Canada Yukon
caption_cleaned: On this day in , the village of Snag in the Yukon hit degrees Celsius, the lowest confirmed temperature ever recorded in North America! Visit our “This Week in History” section to learn more: This photo was taken in Kluane National Park and Reserve, south of Snag. Parks Canada Yukon

caption_original: This week, we’re recognizing Harriet Tubman for #BlackHistoryMonth. She was one of the great heroes of the Abolitionist Movement and led slaves to safety in St. Catharines, Ontario through the Underground Railroad.
caption_cleaned: This week, we’re recognizing Harriet Tubman for . She was one of the great heroes of the Abolitionist Movement and led slaves to safety in St. Catharines, Ontario through the Underground Railroad.

caption_original:
Happy International #PolarBearDay!

Did you know Wapusk National Park protects one of the largest polar bear denning areas in the world?

Learn more: http://bit.ly/wapusk-e Polar Bears International Churchill Northern Studies Centre Conserve, Restore, and Connect with Nature
caption_cleaned: Happy International ! Did you know Wapusk National Park protects one of the largest polar bear denning areas in the world? Learn more: Polar Bears International Churchill Northern Studies Centre Conserve, Restore, and Connect with Nature

caption_original:
It’s #BlackHistoryMonth! This week, we’re highlighting John Ware. In the 1880s, Ware became famous at Bar-U Ranch in Alberta for his legendary cowboy skills and friendly demeanour. He later went on to open his very own ranch.

Plan a visit to Bar-U Ranch National Historic Site to learn more: http://www.pc.gc.ca/eng/lhn-nhs/ab/baru/index.aspx

caption_original: I was a politician, businessman, defender of human rights and the first Black person to hold public office in British Columbia. My name is Mifflin Wistar Gibbs

caption_original:
This week in #BlackHistoryMonth, we’re highlighting Marie Marguerite Rose. After 19 years of slavery, she became a successful business owner and a distinguished community member at the Fortress of Louisbourg.

You can meet our Marie Marguerite Rose interpreter at the Fortress of Louisbourg National Historic Site
